metadata.title: CVE-2021-21199 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Use after free in Aura in Google Chrome on Linux prior to 89.0.4389.114allowed a remote attacker who had compromised the renderer process topotentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-21199` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 90.0.4430.72-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 90.0.4430.72-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 90.0.4430.72-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 90.0.4430.72-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 90.0.4430.72-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '90.0.4430.72-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
